hypothesis_content.title: Post-CPI Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a major CPI print that causes a whipsaw (≥3% intraday range) but closes within ±0.5% of open, the subsequent 24-hour period will see amplified directional momentum in the direction of the initial post-announcement spike, as trapped liquidity and failed breakout positions are cleared.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Major CPI events create intense, immediate volatility as algorithms react. A whipsaw that fails to sustain suggests initial overreaction. The subsequent break of the spike extreme indicates the 'real' directional conviction as weak hands are stopped out and momentum builds on the true catalyst interpretation.
entry_conditions: Major US CPI print released within last 4 hours
BTC 4-hour closing candle is within ±0.5% of pre-announcement price
BTC breaks above post-CPI spike high or below spike low on 15-minute chart

exit_conditions.take_profit: 2.5x the post-CPI spike range (measured from entry)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 1.5x the post-CPI spike range (opposite side of entry)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such setups result in a false breakout (price reverses beyond stop-loss before hitting take-profit) over a 6-month backtest period.
